skill.name: scientific-slides
skill.description: Build slide decks and presentations for research talks. Use this for making PowerPoint slides, conference presentations, seminar talks, research presentations, thesis defense slides, or any scientific talk. Provides slide structure, design templates, timing guidance, and visual validation. Works with PowerPoint and LaTeX Beamer.

skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The skill is a legitimate scientific presentation tool. Static findings are primarily false positives from documentation patterns. Network access is for documented AI image generation with user-provided API keys. Subprocess calls are for local PDF/image operations. No malicious intent or data exfiltration patterns found.

content.value_statement: This skill helps researchers create professional presentations for conferences, seminars, and thesis defenses. It provides slide templates, design guidance, and AI-powered image generation for PowerPoint and LaTeX Beamer formats.
actual_capabilities: Generate complete presentation slides using AI image generation
Create LaTeX Beamer presentations with provided templates
Validate presentations for timing, slide count, and design quality
Convert slide images to PDF for distribution
Provide design guidance for scientific presentations
limitations: Requires OpenRouter API key for AI slide generation features
Does not create editable PowerPoint files directly (generates images)
Design templates require customization for specific use cases

use_cases.title: Conference presentation
use_cases.description: Generate slides for academic conferences with proper citations and professional design

use_cases.title: Thesis defense
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive defense presentations with structured narrative and visual aids

use_cases.title: Seminar talks
use_cases.description: Build detailed seminar presentations with LaTeX Beamer for mathematical content

prompt_templates.title: Basic slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a presentation slide titled [TITLE] with these key points: [POINTS]. Use a [COLOR] color scheme with modern design.

prompt_templates.title: With citations
prompt_templates.scenario: Add research citations to a slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slide titled [TITLE] with content about [TOPIC]. Include citations at bottom: (Author et al., YEAR; Author2 et al., YEAR2).

prompt_templates.title: Consistent style
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a slide titled [TITLE] with [CONTENT]. FORMATTING GOAL: Match attached slide style exactly - same colors, fonts, and design.

prompt_templates.title: Visual figure
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a professional diagram showing [CONCEPT]. Modern flat design, suitable for scientific presentations. Output just the visual.

output_examples.input: Create a title slide for a machine learning conference presentation
output: Modern color scheme with clean typography
Generous white space and visual hierarchy

output_examples.input: Generate a results slide comparing two datasets
output: Professional chart design with accessible colors
Key findings highlighted in bullet points

best_practices: Plan your narrative arc before generating slides - follow the story structure: hook, context, problem, approach, results, implications
Maintain visual consistency by attaching previous slides and reusing formatting goals across all slides
Use research-lookup to find proper citations and add 3-5 citations in introduction and discussion sections
anti_patterns: Creating text-heavy slides with more than 6 bullet points per slide - violates visual-first design principle
Using default PowerPoint or Beamer themes without customization - looks generic and unprofessional
Skipping practice sessions - always practice with timer at least 3 times before presentation

faq.question: Does this create editable PowerPoint files?
faq.answer: It generates slide images for PDF workflow. For editable PPTX, use --visual-only flag and combine with PPTX skill.

faq.question: What API key do I need?
faq.answer: An OpenRouter API key for AI image generation. Get one at openrouter.ai/keys and set OPENROUTER_API_KEY environment variable.

faq.question: Can I use this without AI generation?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the LaTeX Beamer templates and validation scripts without requiring API keys for local workflow.

faq.question: What presentation formats are supported?
faq.answer: PDF workflow (AI-generated slides), PowerPoint (via generated images), and LaTeX Beamer (native templates).

faq.question: How many slides for a 15-minute talk?
faq.answer: Target 15-18 slides following the one-slide-per-minute guideline. Adjust for complexity - simple slides take less time.

faq.question: Does it include citations and references?
faq.answer: The skill integrates with research-lookup for finding papers. You add citations to prompts, and AI includes them on generated slides.
